title:
Virtual Full-Duplex Wireless Communications with Zero-Interval
  Modulation and Sampling
authors: Jianyu Wang, Wenchi Cheng, Wei Zhang, Hailin Zhang
abstract:
In this paper, we propose a virtual full-duplex (VFD) technique with
zero-interval modulation and sampling (ZIMS), where two half-duplex (HD)
transceivers can simultaneously transmit signals and each transceiver can
effectively receive the desired information. In ZIMS-VFD, the transceiver
inserts a zero-interval for each symbol in the transmit signal and provides
self-interference (SI)-free intervals for itself. Meanwhile, it samples the
receive signal in the provided SI-free intervals and restores the desired
symbols. Based on orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM), we
formulate the system model and show the transmit signal structure. Then, we
give the transceiver design for single input single output (SISO) ZIMS-VFD and
extend it to multiple input multiple output (MIMO) communications. Numerical
results verify our theoretical analyses and show that ZIMS-VFD can effectively
increase the capacity and approach the FD without SI.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
